intro: Orthocarpus barbatus, commonly known as the hairy orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in shrublands and grasslands. Its distinctive hairy stems and leaves help it retain moisture in arid environments. It is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine.
